briefdescription.para: The Channel index out of range.
The table data for channel is missing.
The channel open failure.
Channel is unknown.

simplesect.para: This state means the channel was either never initialized or failed to initialized and is in an unusable state (no data flow).

briefdescription.para: Channel closed state.

simplesect.para: This state means that the channel is not operational (no data flow).

briefdescription.para: Channel opened state.

simplesect.para: This state means the channel is operational (data can flow).

briefdescription.para: This is a count of Channel states and should not be used.
Channel States.

detaileddescription.para:
TO channels can have three states:
TO_CHANNEL_UNKNOWN TO_CHANNEL_OPENED TO_CHANNEL_CLOSED

simplesect.para: All channels that are opened will never be commanded to close. The only time where a channel is closed is during clean-up.

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint32 index, const char *ChannelName, const char *ConfigTableName, const char *ConfigTableFileName, TO_ChannelTbl_t *BackupTblPtr, const char *DumpTableName, const uint32 CfCntSemMax, const char *CfCntSemName)
memberdef.name: TO_Channel_OpenChannel

briefdescription.para: Configures and initializes a single channel.

detaileddescription.para:
Description
Initializes channel specific data and structures. Sets up channel pipe as well as initializing the cf throttling semaphore for each channel. Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
Semaphore name must be unique among channels; initialization will fail if two channels attempt to use the same semaphore. The pointers for ChannelName, ConfigTableName, ConfigTableFileName, DumpTableName, and CfCntSemName are not checked for NULL since those are passed in as arguments that have been macro defined in to_platform_cfg.h and are checked in a verify header to ensure the macros exist. Only the index is range-checked and no other argument checking is performed.

index
Index of the channel, cannot be greater than TO_MAX_CHANNELS
ChannelName
Name of channel, will be prefixed with TO_ . NOTE: Since each channel has a child task thread with the same name, and in RTEMS threads must have names of 4 chars, this param should be a single char.
The 4-char limit is an RTEMS limit. The RTEMS OSAL only takes the first 4 chars of the name per RTEMS limits for the underlying RTEMS message queue but still preserves the full name given to it in the OSAL The 1-char limit helps with keeping the name short enough to view it via RTEMS reports

parameterdescription.para: Name of the config table for the channel as referred to by TBL services
File path of the channel config table
Name of the dump table for the channel as referred to by TBL services
The initial maximum value of the CF throttling semaphore for this channel.
Name of the CF throttling semaphore, must be unique among each channel.

simplesect.para: CFE_SUCCESS if successful. TO_CHANNEL_OUT_OF_RANGE_ERR or OSAL error if unsuccessful.

briefdescription.para: Forwards all channel's telemetry data to TO_Classifier and TO_Scheduler.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: Assumes channel pointer is not NULL

briefdescription.para: Resets all channel's message flow, priority queue, and output queue counters.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: Assumes channel pointer is not NULL

briefdescription.para: Set's a channel reference based on a valid input index and calls TO_Channel_LockByRef.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: If the input index is out of range, an event is generated TO_CHANNEL_OUT_OF_RANGE_ERR_EID

briefdescription.para: Set's a channel reference based on a valid input index and calls TO_Channel_UnlockByRef.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: If the input index is out of range, an event is generated TO_CHANNEL_OUT_OF_RANGE_ERR_EID

briefdescription.para: The mutex object referenced by the channel pointer shall be locked by calling this function.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: Assumes channel pointer is not NULL

briefdescription.para: The mutex object referenced by the channel pointer shall be unlocked by calling this function.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: Assumes channel pointer is not NULL

briefdescription.para: Loops through channel less than TO_MAX_CHANNELS and initializes a reference to each channel's channel data, sets the channel's index, and creates each channel's mutex.
Loops through channel less than TO_MAX_CHANNELS and calls functions to teardown each channel's priority queue, output queue, and message flow(s). It also deletes each channel's mutex.
Returns a input channel's state.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: If the input index is out of range, the channel state is TO_CHANNEL_UNKNOWN.

briefdescription.para: Flush priority and output queues for the channel.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function is called by command from the operators, and will wipe all messages from output queue and priority queue buffers without resetting the current table.

detaileddescription.para: The command failed, if index is greater than or equal to TO_MAX_CHANNELS or if TO_PriorityQueue_TeardownAll or TO_OutputQueue_Teardown do not return CFE_SUCCESS or if TO_Channel_SBPipe_Dequeue_All returns FALSE

briefdescription.para: Empty all messages in the SB data pipe for this channel.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This function is called in TO_Channel_Flush() and also on table switch.

detaileddescription.para: The function failed, if index is greater than or equal to TO_MAX_CHANNELS or if CFE_SB_RcvMsg does not return CFE_SUCCESS
